org-entry-head.alt-name: Democratic Alliance of Croats in Vojvodina
League of Social Democrats of Vojvodina

org-entry.found-date: 1992 as Demokratska Stranka Srbije following split from Demokratska Stranka

org-entry.content-note: supports liberal economic reform and the integration of Serbia into the European Union

org-entry-head.alt-name: Party of United Pensioners of Serbia

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Partia për Vertim Demokratik/Partija za Demokratsko Delovanje

org-entry.content-note: represents interests of ethnic Albanian population

org-entry.found-date: 2020 by merger of Samostalni DSS and Pokret za Razvoj Srbije (Movement for Development of Serbia)

org-entry.content-note: formed an alliance with the Stranka Demokratske Akcije Sandžaka (Party of Democratic Action of Sandžak) from 2013

org-entry.found-date: 2014 as Novo Demokratska Stranka (New Democratic Party)
1990 by merger of Savez Komunista Srbije (League of Communists of Serbia) and Socijalistički Savez Radnog Naroda Srbije (Socialist Alliance of Working People of Serbia)
2008 as breakaway party from the SRS (q.v.)
org-entry.content-note: contested 2023 legislative elections as leader of the Aleksandar Vučić—Srbija Ne Sme Da Stane (Aleksandar Vučić—Serbia Must Not Stop) alliance
advocates a `Greater Serbian’ state of territories inhabited by Serbs within and outside Serbia

org-entry-head.alt-name: Party of Democratic Action of Sandžak

org-entry.content-note: br. of the Stranka Demokratske Akcije (Bosnia and Herzegovina)
represents Bosniak minority in Sandžak region

org-entry.found-date: 2014 as Bošnjačka Demokratska Zajednica Sandžaka (Bosniak Democratic Union of Sandžak)
org-entry.content-note: represents interests of Bosniak Muslim population of Sandžak region

org-entry-head.org-entry-name: Vajdasági Magyarok Demokratikus Közössége/Demokratska Zajednica Vojvođanskih Mađara
